translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

Enclosed are the entitled Colonels Joaquim Pedro and José Mariano de Matos and a captain and a soldier; immediately Your Lordship Antônio Manuel do Amaral went to the town of Jaguarão to plunder with 150 men and was repulsed by the police of Jaguarão, assisted by the infantry and navy, with Amaral himself and a lieutenant and 5 or 6 soldiers killed, and a lieutenant and 6 soldiers wounded; and on our side we had to lament a sergeant killed; this is what the same captain who is imprisoned and who was at the attack tells me; for now I have not yet had official news; if the men of the 2nd Corps who remained to bring armament have not yet departed, Your Lordship Canguçu.

God keep Your Lordship
Campo at the tips of Piratini, June 28, 1844.

Most Illustrious Sir Luís José Ferreira, Lieutenant-Colonel Commander of the Garrison of the city of Pelotas.

Francisco Pedro de Abreu.
